msgs.text: - A transaction is created with the RBF flag, indicating that this transaction can be fee bumped

- When a fee increase is required, a new transaction is signed, *spending one or more of the inputs of the previous transaction*, which will remove the old transaction and replace it with this one if some conditions are met
  - All inputs were not spent or the transactions that spends those UTXOs are in the mempool and have RBF enabled
  - The TX pays more fees in sats than all the transactions it is replacing
  - The feerate of the transaction is at least `1 sat/vB` higher than the replaced transactions
You may "undo" a payment with this if it's still in the mempool.
This is why you shouldn't accept 0/unconfirmed transactions: They are not confirmed and can be "reverted" (replaced by another TX that transfers to the sender's own wallet)
